repositories.brief_summary: Windows platform focus with winpthreads removal, relocatable OCaml, and thread-safety improvements
repositories.new_features_summary: Relocatable OCaml installations, native Windows concurrency primitives, thread-safe POSIX functions
repositories.new_features:
- **Relocatable OCaml installations** now supported through generated opam `.install` file and relocation support script, enabling OCaml to be moved after installation ([#14246](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/pull/14246))
- **Native Windows concurrency primitives** replace winpthreads dependency with direct WinAPI implementation, removing external dependency and improving Windows platform support ([#13416](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/pull/13416))
- **Thread-safe POSIX functions** adopted in libunix using `getgrnam_r`, `getgrgid_r`, `getpwnam_r`, `getpwuid_r`, `gmtime_r`, `localtime_r`, and `getlogin_r` for improved thread safety ([#13700](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/pull/13700))
- **Spawned domains inherit backtrace settings** from parent domain, improving debugging experience across domain boundaries ([#14416](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/pull/14416))
- **Fixed packed modules** on case-insensitive filesystems (macOS) by rewriting pack prefixes to use appropriate separators ([#14417](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/pull/14417))
- **Improved thread naming** on Windows with fixed `SetThreadDescription` detection on 32-bit platforms, enabling `Thread.set_current_thread_name` functionality ([#14423](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/pull/14423))
- **Enhanced Dynarray type safety** using opaque abstract type for `with_dummy`, future-proofing against compiler optimizations ([#14084](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/pull/14084))
- **Documentation clarification** for `__FUNCTION__` to explicitly document behavior with module-level let-bindings ([#14412](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/pull/14412))

repositories.discussions_summary: Discussion on unmarshaling OOM issue in 5.x and proposed GC pacing fix
repositories.notable_discussions:
- **Unmarshaling memory issue** in OCaml 5.x reported by [Török Edwin](https://github.com/edwintorok) where unmarshaling loops can fail with out-of-memory errors, with [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) proposing `caml_request_major_slice` fix for GC pacing ([#14419](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14419))
- **Module signature type inference** discussion by [@Alex1005a](https://github.com/Alex1005a) requesting ability to omit type declarations in structures when present in signatures, with [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) suggesting `_` placeholder approach for importing declarations ([#14418](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14418))

- **Windows socketpair TOCTOU race** investigation by [Nathan Taylor](https://github.com/dijkstracula) identifying possible time-of-check-time-of-use vulnerability in socketpair implementation with temp file deletion ([#14372](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14372))

repositories.brief_summary: Three new custom LSP requests for type expression, locate, and phrase navigation merged, plus version 1.25.0 release
repositories.new_features_summary: Three custom requests added: typeExpression for type querying, locate for identifier search with prefix, and phrase for navigation
repositories.new_features:
- **Custom request `ocamllsp/typeExpression`** returns the type of a given expression as a string, useful for editor integrations that need type information without full hover support ([#1576](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1576))
- **Custom request `ocamllsp/locate`** enables searching for definitions, declarations, or type definitions by identifier with optional prefix parameter, addressing limitations in the standard LSP protocol for Merlin's locate capabilities ([#1576](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1576), closes [#1570](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1570))
- **Custom request `ocamllsp/phrase`** provides navigation to next or previous top-level definitions or module definitions, returning position information for phrase boundaries ([#1576](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1576))
- **Updated configuration documentation** in `config.md` to reflect current implementation including `standardHover`, granular `inlayHints` options (`hintPatternVariables`, `hintLetBindings`, `hintFunctionParams`), and `shortenMerlinDiagnostics` settings ([#1575](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1575))
- **Yojson lower bound** added to jsonrpc package for better dependency management ([79b2285](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/commit/79b2285d61ee052e493e99af43f4aec9114d7a10))

repositories.discussions_summary: Detailed technical discussion on projection syntax trade-offs between usability and error message clarity
repositories.notable_discussions:
- **Syntax choice for labeled tuple projections** sparked detailed debate in [#57](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/57) weighing `e.l` (consistent with record syntax and type-disambiguated features, originally suggested by [Samuel Vivien](https://github.com/samsa1)) against `e.~l` (clearer errors but conflicts with MetaOCaml), with [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) prioritizing error message quality for beginners using nominal records over convenience for labeled tuple users
- **Error message quality** concerns raised by [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) regarding how `e.l` syntax defaults to record projection when type information is unknown, potentially creating confusing errors that mention advanced OCaml features unfamiliar to users
- **Feature complexity perception** discussed with [Andrey Popp](https://github.com/andreypopp) noting labeled tuples feel similar in complexity to labeled arguments based on OCaml 5.4 usage experience, though [Alistair](https://github.com/johnyob) and [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) agreed they are less commonly used than nominal records

repositories.new_features_summary: Added compiler flags, enhanced jkind APIs, and improved mode system with new hints
repositories.new_features:
- Added compiler flags `-locs`/`-no-locs` and `-dprofile-output` for location tracking and profiling output control ([#203](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/203))
- Enhanced `Jkind.of_const` API with `ran_out_of_fuel_during_normalize` parameter for better normalization tracking ([ae8671a](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/commit/ae8671ada8e2dd5a0d002b361563ff0ec453445c))
- Extended `Jkind.for_boxed_variant` with additional parameters (`decl_params`, `type_apply`, `free_vars`) for more precise variant type analysis ([ae8671a](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/commit/ae8671ada8e2dd5a0d002b361563ff0ec453445c))
- Added `Cases_result` to `Mode_hint.pinpoint_desc` for tracking mode hints in pattern matching result positions ([ae8671a](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/commit/ae8671ada8e2dd5a0d002b361563ff0ec453445c))
- Introduced `Always_dynamic` and `Branching` mode hint constants for better mode constraint tracking in dynamic contexts ([ae8671a](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/commit/ae8671ada8e2dd5a0d002b361563ff0ec453445c))
- Added `min_with_monadic` function to `Mode` API for setting specific monadic axis elements ([ae8671a](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/commit/ae8671ada8e2dd5a0d002b361563ff0ec453445c))
- Enhanced `Env.address` type with jkind sort array in `Adot` constructor for better module addressing ([ae8671a](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/commit/ae8671ada8e2dd5a0d002b361563ff0ec453445c))
- Unified `Env.fold_modules` and `Env.fold_modtypes` to use lazy declarations, removing separate `_lazy` variants ([ae8671a](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/commit/ae8671ada8e2dd5a0d002b361563ff0ec453445c))
- Extended `Typedecl.transl_value_decl` with modal parameter and jkind history reason for improved value declaration translation ([ae8671a](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/commit/ae8671ada8e2dd5a0d002b361563ff0ec453445c))
- Added `Module` variant to `Mixed_product_kind` and new `assert_mixed_product_support` function for module-level mixed product validation ([ae8671a](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/commit/ae8671ada8e2dd5a0d002b361563ff0ec453445c))
- Updated error reporting with `Non_representable_in_module` replacing `Non_value_in_sig` for clearer module representation errors ([ae8671a](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/commit/ae8671ada8e2dd5a0d002b361563ff0ec453445c))

group_summaries.brief_summary: Dune dev tools expansion, LSP custom requests, opam performance work, and merlin legacy platform support
group_summaries.new_features_summary: Merlin dev tool support in Dune, three custom LSP requests, opam shell completion, duplicate dependency warnings
group_summaries.new_features:
- **Merlin dev tool support** added to [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) by [Sachin Beniwal](https://github.com/benodiwal), enabling automated installation and management via `dune tools` alongside ocamlformat and odoc ([ocaml/dune#12972](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12972))
- **Three custom LSP requests** implemented in [ocaml/ocaml-lsp](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp) by [Xavier Van de Woestyne](https://github.com/xvw): `ocamllsp/typeExpression` for querying expression types, `ocamllsp/locate` for searching identifiers with optional prefix, and `ocamllsp/phrase` for navigating top-level definitions ([ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1576](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1576), fixes [ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1570](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1570))
- **Duplicate dependency warnings** now emitted in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) when package definitions contain duplicate package names by [Sachin Beniwal](https://github.com/benodiwal) ([ocaml/dune#12986](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12986), fixes [ocaml/dune#2678](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/2678))
- **Shell completion environment variables** implemented in [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) by [Brian Ward](https://github.com/WardBrian), setting `XDG_DATA_DIRS` for bash-completion and `FPATH` for zsh in `opam env` ([ocaml/opam#6812](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6812))
- **Workspace binaries in env stanza** now properly resolved in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) when generating rules for `./.bin` directory by [Antonio Nuno Monteiro](https://github.com/anmonteiro) ([ocaml/dune#12952](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12952), fixes [ocaml/dune#6220](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/6220))
- **Availability constraint filtering** added to [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) via `--ignore-available-on` argument by [Brian Ward](https://github.com/WardBrian), enabling bypass of availability constraints for specific packages during compatibility testing ([ocaml/opam#6836](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6836), fixes [ocaml/opam#5283](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/5283))
- **Cache location changes** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune): toolchains and revision store caches now respect `DUNE_CACHE_ROOT` environment variable by [Ambre Austen Suhamy](https://github.com/ElectreAAS) ([ocaml/dune#12858](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12858), fixes [ocaml/dune#11584](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11584))
- **Windows lock file handling** fixed in [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) during switch and repository format upgrades by reusing existing global lock file descriptor by [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) ([ocaml/opam#6839](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6839))
- **Build fix for OCaml 4.13.1** in [ocaml/merlin](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin) by [Antonin Décimo](https://github.com/MisterDA), fixing C code include directive for `<stdcountof.h>` header ([ocaml/merlin#2016](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/2016))
- **Float printing precision** improved in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) `Dyn.to_string` to ensure round-trip capability by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) ([ocaml/dune#12982](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12982), fixes [ocaml/dune#12980](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12980))
- **Extensive trace event system enhancements** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg), including final event emission on exit ([ocaml/dune#13018](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13018)), process ID and working directory in config events ([ocaml/dune#13026](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13026)), process categories moved to args field ([ocaml/dune#13024](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13024)), and new config and async event categories ([ocaml/dune#13021](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13021), [ocaml/dune#13022](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13022))
- **Version 1.25.0 released** for [ocaml/ocaml-lsp](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp) by [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos), including custom requests, `.mlx` file support, configurable code-lens for nested bindings, improved metrics precision, and `.merlin` fallback support
